prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom The first part of the CAD model is a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Step 1: Create a new coordinate system Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] Step 2: Draw the 2D sketch Create a new 2D sketch using the coordinate system created in step 1. Step 3: Draw the lines Draw four lines on the sketch plane: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.45] - Line 3: Start Point [0.75, 0.45], End Point [0.0, 0.45] - Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.45], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Step 4: Close the loop Close the loop by connecting the last point of Line 4 to the starting point of Line 1. Step 5: Extrude the 2D sketch Extrude the 2D sketch to a depth of 0.12 towards the normal direction, and a depth of 0.0 in the opposite direction of the normal. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. Part 2: Construct a cylindrical object with a smaller cylindrical hole in the center The second part of the CAD model is a cylindrical object with a smaller cylindrical hole in the center. Step 1: Create a new coordinate system Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0923, 0.2422, 0.12] Step 2: Draw the 2D sketch Create a new 2D sketch using the coordinate system created in step 1. Step 3: Draw the circles Draw two circles on the sketch plane: - Circle 1: Center [0.0427, 0.0427], Radius 0.0427 - Circle 2: Center [0.5227, 0.0427], Radius 0.0427 Step 4: Extrude the 2D sketch Extrude the 2D sketch to a depth of 0.0 towards the normal direction, and a depth of 0.12 in the opposite direction of the normal. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.5655. Step 5: Cut the cylindrical hole Perform a cut operation on the cylindrical object to remove the smaller cylindrical hole. Final Shape: A rectangular prism with a tapered top and bottom The final CAD model is a rectangular prism with a tapered top and bottom, achieved by combining the two intermediate CAD parts. The height of the final shape is half the length of the sides, while the length and width are equal to the length of the sides of the rectangular prism. The tapered top and bottom are achieved by the extrusion and scaling of the first intermediate CAD part. The second intermediate CAD part is used to create a cylindrical hole in the final shape. The resulting shape is a solid object with a smooth surface.</description>
